Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: Chicago5StarTraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked a Deluxe room which was featured in the hotel's webpage as spacious, and with a large bathroom. It turned out to be the smallest room I've ever been in. Instead of the king size bed that I ordered I was given two twin beds one next to the other, which meant I had a "gap" in the middle of the alleged king size bed, which widened as the night went by. Finally, I tried the food at the Senzone restaurant and it was incredibly bad. When my plate was picked up by the waitress after barely touching my food, she didn't care to ask why I hadn't eaten. To summarize, please don't stay at this hotel. Trying to give customers bad rooms in a five star hotel after selling something completely different on their website, is a third world scam that must not be supported by visitors to a city with real five star hotels like the Villamagna.

Reviews.Title: “luxury place”
Reviews.Author: Miumiu1015
Reviews.Content: we stay here for one night.just two days ago. thats our honeymoon . we didn't tell the hotel that's our purpose, but they still have wonder service like suit for us.Bathroom was a bit odd but looked modern and fancy.Hospes is located on plaza Independencia,at night we stay in front of wine bar such enjoyful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Diana B
Reviews.Content: Purpose: I needed an hotel in Madrid same day. I had no info about hotels in Madrid. I needed a nice and cosy hotel, with a quiet room as I was sick and needed absolut rest. I discovered Hospes hotel by chance, located 50 meters from friends house. Location: Hospes is located on plaza Independencia, Puerta de Alcalá, just between museums and shopping area. Room: May room was very quiet (my only request), with all amenities. Decoration very peaceful, all white and grey, TV, mini bar, sofa, AC, large shower, large windows. Hotel: High standard hotel. Very nice staff. (there is a spa which I didn't visit)

Reviews.Title: “Don't think we'll stay elsewhere in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Marta M
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Hospes Madrid this year. Don't think we'll stay elsewhere in Madrid. Great location, large size rooms, US king-size bed, firm mattress, excellent quality linens, wonderful staff and love the smell of hotel fragance. My husband flight was delayed so he arrived after midnight and the reception prepared sandwiches after the kitchen was closed. We want to stay in its sister hotel, Hospes Maricel when we go to Mallorca:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: EReview
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from staying in this wonderful boutique hotel in central Madrid. The room we stayed in was quiet, had twin beds, was spacious and had a beautiful well appointed bathroom with large bath and shower. There were two sinks, a large mirror and quality products and we could not have wanted for more. On our first evening we had a problem accessing our room because the door lock was faulty and once fixed the hotel staff very kindly sent a bottle of bubbly and delicious chocolates to help us get over the inconvenience, which was a very welcome gesture. The staff were courteous and helpful throughout our stay and recommended various restaurants for us to visit. Madrid is a beautiful city with lots of historic buildings, beautiful open spaces and delicious food. As other reviewers have remarked if you want to spoil yourself go and visit Madrid and do not think twice about staying in this lovely hotel. Go on you know you want to and you deserve it. If we visit Madrid Madrid we will not hesitate to stay at Hotel Hospes Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMiamiMiami
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in the shopping area of Serrano, and are willing to pay for a real 5* hotel, this is definitely your choice. It is not a big hotel, but rather a boutique hotel, with all kind of 21st century comfort, but built in a 19th century palace. All rooms are different; we stayed twice in July and in August, and they were all super comfortable. Great bed, and amazing shower. Service was amazing. I am surprised at reading other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “For a 6 year anniversary, I couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT! If you want to spoil yourself, do stay there! It was our anniversary and one I won't forget. The place beautiful, friendly, great location, close to transport, professional and attention to detail. The buffet breakfast was superb, the rooms were luxurious and comfortable. Another thing that stood out were the staff, I needed to arrange transport and without asking and hesitation the staff printed a timetable for me to review which was exactly what I needed. I had a great time in Madrid and if you choose to stay there, I am sure you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: blingster44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week July 19th to 22nd must say this hotel in centrally located lovely boutique hotel smart rooms which are large ext clean lovely bathroom with sep shower large bath.. Hotel staff were excellent very helpful would highly recomend..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: Linegray74
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely, staff great. Great location, within walking distance and handy for the metro, park and great bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but service a bit distant”
Reviews.Author: MontrealUser10
Reviews.Content: So, the good things about this hotel are (1) location, which is close enough to walk to the Prado and the touristy things but not so close that it is a zoo; (2) design - some of the rooms (not all) are really quite nice; suites and the Alcala view ones in particular; (3) pool (but see below). The not so good things: (1) for such a small hotel, the service is remarkably impersonal. Don't expect the staff to fully tell you about the amenities or be proactive to assist; (2) those restaurants just below the hotel (and there are three of them) are loud...which can be a problem if you are above them; (3) pool - which is really very small; and (4) price. Having said this, it is a fine option for Madrid, and I would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: For starters, Hospes is located perfectly in Madrid. Its very central and clos to everywhere we wanted to go. Everything else about the hotel was great too, the staff, the food, and the spa. Would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Avishay789
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Sleek, modern design in the room. Very clean and comfortable. Right by the park, and near metro stations. We walked everywhere in the tourist area of Madrid from the hotel with no problem. There are hotels closer to the center, but we preferred something a bit quieter and more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Acwl
Reviews.Content: We booked the deluxe room and it was lovely. Agree that with other reviewers that its probably not a 5 star hotel though. The check in experience wasn't too pleasant, the staff really didn't make you feel welcome, as if they are doing you a favour checking you in. Nothing beats the location of the hotel. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 stars hotel in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Ann E
Reviews.Content: Was there with my husband three days. All was perfect. All staff was friendly and helpfully. The hotel stay at the best area in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Madrid Hospes”
Reviews.Author: Floris R
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very kind and efficient personnel, super location with nice dining on the terrace outside. Only, the room is a bit inside, though very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “2 star service”
Reviews.Author: evon802
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be a 5 star but in reality, it's at best a 4 star with 2 star service. The front desk staff were incredibly rude during check-in and no one offered to help us with our two large suitcases or showed us the way to our room. The decor is contemporary but very dull and lacks imagination - think white, chrome, and Plexiglas. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable but definitely not 5 star plush. Facing the Puerta de Alcala and the Retiro Park, the location of the hotel is superb if you are willing to put up with the terrible attitude and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great bolt hole for a city break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: golferGill
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in early May to watch some tennis at the Madrid Open and explore Madrid. Lovely small boutique hotel in a great location for exploring the city right by the entrance to Retiro Park. Good sized room with comfortable beds and superbly equipped bathroom. My husband is a light sleeper so we had requested a quiet room and it was certainly that - we didn't hear a thing even on the night Atletico Madrid won the Europa Cup and the whole city was partying! The air conditioning was efficient and very quiet. Excellent breakfast and service. Will certainly stay at the Hospes again if we go back to Madrid and will look at their hotels in other parts of Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service on the terrace at Hospes Madrid”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited the Hospes Madrid to have a gin & tonic on the terrace before having dinner at a local restaurant on Saturday, 26th May. The setting is quite unique, it overlooks Puerta de Alcala so it´s a great place to see the world pass by. We sat at a dirty table and waited long time for someone to come and see us. It was evident the place was short of staff as there were a lot of people waving or raising their arms to catch the waiter´s attention. We even witnessed many guests getting up and going inside to place drink orders. When the waiter finally came to our table, he asked us what we wanted but we requested to see the menu first. Our request seemed to be quite unusual for him as he gave us a look of surprise. He came back a few minutes later with a dirty menu which was a real let down. We ordered two different brands of gin listed on the menu and they were not available (5-star?). Drinks were delivered after a long time so we started to be a bit impatient as it was getting late for our appointment. It was a real struggle to get the bill and pay as staff were under a lot of pressure to serve so many people. Before leaving, we spoke to a gentleman in a suit, who seemed to be the Supervisor on duty. We told him that we were disappointed with the service and he said that the management were aware of the situation but didn´t apologize. We paid 32 euros for two gin & tonics so it wasn´t cheap. This was certainly not a 5-star experience and won´t come back or recommend Hospes Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SJ C
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor throughout the hotel and ideally situated to be able to explore the city. Friendly staff albeit we weren't made fully aware of all the hotel amenities I.e swimming pool and gym. Whilst our room was located immediately on the very busy plaza there was no noise to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “World-class hotel (or close to it)”
Reviews.Author: Thomas A
Reviews.Content: Our reservation at Hospes Madrid was done by our Spanish travel agent (Made for Spain), who planned our complete itinerary. Hospes Madrid would be our first stop on our trip after a transatlantic flight. We had no idea what what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room we had was beautifully furnished. The location (as other reviewers have noted) was terrific -- a bustling plaza close to major sites with three sidewalk cafes in front of the hotel. The Hospes Madrid is not for the budget-minded. But if you are willing to pay for a first-class boutique hotel in the heart of Madrid, this is the place for you. When we return to Madrid, we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Substance under Form”
Reviews.Author: 64cbw
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and the welcome was warm (with the offer of champagne) Sitting outside on a February night, watching the people whilst sipping my drink, is a memory I will keep. However... The shower smelt of mould They seem to assume you know how the hotel runs, without actually telling you (restaurant times, breakfast, other services) On my final day, I left my bags at the hotel to collect later. When I returned, reception said I had not handed in my key and then tried to charge me €50. I was adamant that I had returned it and left. No charge has appeared on my credit card - and no apology from the hotel has arrived. Will I return again to Madrid, yes. Will I book a Hospes hotel again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Susy Q
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here March 2012. We were very satisfied. The location is great, a 5 minute walk to the Prado and Thyssen museums. Buses stop right out front and you are in the center (at Plaza de Sol) in a few stops, could walk it in 10 minutes or so if you want. The subway system is also one block way from the hotel and right across from Retiro Park which is huge and a pleasnt place for a walk. The Hospes is in the classy, upscale part of town and there were lots of restaurants nearby. The breakfast is too expensive, so go to one of the cafes - there are 3 within steps of the hotel. We liked Vait, just a block or 2 two down the street towards the center. A few commments on the hotel itself - good beds, very comfortable and clean. All the staff was friendly and helpful and spoke english -. good suggestions for where to eat. Although it is on a busy street we had no trouble sleeping, they must have well insulated windows. As others have mentioned the bath was open to the room, which was fine for us (couple). It was large and clean and the shower was good. My only negative comment is that the floors could have been cleaner for 5 stars. But they give you those slippers so we just kept them on. TV - all spanish, one english news. Didn't use the spa so can't comment on that. We would go there again and plan to check out other locations in Spain (it is a small chain of hotels in historic buildings). Also good is the AeroExpress bus from the airport costs 2 Euro/person and stops at Plaza de la Cibeles which is 3-4 blocks from the hotel (500 meters). Much cheaper than a taxi and it runs every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: narendra_kudva
Reviews.Content: My great experience started even before I entered the Hotel. The girl at the reception saw our taxi pull up outside the Hotel and came out to help with our bags... being chivalrous we refused :-) Every time we came to the reception, we were always greeted by a smile on the face. Walking distance from city centre and shopping areas The room was compact and neat...did not spend much time at the Hotel as was on business and left in the morning only to come to the room at night. However, if I do land up in Valencia again will definitely stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Dogontour
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review as the Hotel is well located, contemporary, and the staff are fantastic. However... The wi Fi doesn't work well, the pool was closed, the haman was dirty and not hot. It's very slightly tired. Saying that a nice bright clean room, well designed and really great staff who fall over themselves to help. Good deals available on the net so I guess overall ok. Would I return ? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, Warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Dasha B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hospes Madrid for 4 nights and were quite delighted with our experience. We were very impressed with the hotel's commitment to warm, quality service and devotion to making our visit to Spain unforgettable. Hospes Madrid is located in the Plaza de la Independencia across from the Puerta Alcala and The Retiro Park. It is a 10 minute walk to the Prado Museum, short walk to great shopping, on both routes of the Hop On double decker tour bus, and in the midst of some of the best quality tapas restaurants in Madrid. Our room was bright, clean and had large windows that would open to the environment of the plaza and the park. We were on the fourth floor, and although we could hear some traffic noise, it was not at all bothersome. The bedding was luxurious and spotless. Thick bathrobes were provided. The Duravit bathrooms were wonderful and the marble tile shower with the rain head fixture was quite spacious. We had a beautiful jetted soaker tub in the bathroom, however, we did not make use of it. As others have pointed out, the door to the shower is see thru, so one has to be quite comfortable with their room mate. Free wifi is a big help and the network is quite strong, compared to other hotels we stayed on our trip. The breakfast was an all you can eat buffet which included croissants, pastries, cheeses, meats, tortillas, cereals and fresh fruits. The cafe con leche and fresh squeezed juices were delicious. We would gladly stay at the Hospes Madrid on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: MCarvalho1
Reviews.Content: Great location. Beautiful hotel, staff very attentive and efficient, we were greeted with a glass of Cava at check-in. Gorgeous room and bathroom! The room faced an inner courtyard, it was very quiet. My only regret is that we only stayed one night! We are planning to go back and stay longer at this hotel and we will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JBMandJCM
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after multiple cross references with reviews, books and guides. Lovely hotel in a great location. Staff could not have been more helpful. Our room looked over the park so we had a great view yet it was amazingly quiet. Real American king bed with luxury linens and pillows. Huge bathroom with separate tub, walk in shower, and separate toilet/bidet. All of the details that we Americans have become accustomed to at home (although would love to find a washcloth in Europe). Free WiFi. Walk to most everything (or metro and taxis steps away) and good restaurants just outside the door or within a few blocks. Nice neighborhood, but easy and entertaining stroll to museums, Puerto de Sol, and Plaza Mayor. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again on our next trip to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: complex_blonde
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed at the Hospes in feb 2012 via a lastminute.com city break which offered 3 nights for the price of two. The hotel has a fantastic location, very central. You can walk everywhere from here and indeed we didn't have to bother with the metro or bus once. It's within a 10 minute walk of all 3 major art museums and about a 15 minute walk to the main squares/tapas areas. On arrival, we were offered a welcome drink of champagne which we thought was a lovely touch. The hotel is beautifully decorated and looks and feels brand new and very clean. The room was lovely - huge and very comfortable bed and a very luxurious bathroom. Lots of posh spa products and dressing gowns are thrown in which was nice. The spa is small - the swimming pool is tiny and you are at one end before you have done more then 4 strokes, but as long as you only want to use it as a hot tub rather than proper swimming it is lovely. It also has a small gym with a couple of treadmills and a bike which we used and was perfectly adequate (in any event, the hotel is right by the Retiro park so you could go jogging round there if the gym was full). We went room only as we're not big eaters and the breakfast is 25E per person, and this was a good call as there is a lovely cafe called H'arina about 1 minute from the hotel which does wonderful breakfasts for about 8E. Would highly recommend this hotel. The only slightly strange thing was that the door to the shower and toilet in the bedroom are see-through, so you don't get much privacy in the bathroom! Something to bear in mind depending on who you are travelling with!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: It's good looking. The room I had was great. The service is excellent and so is the location. It's very good value. Couldn't really ask for more

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service soso, fast-aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: iakov k
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by a receptionist with a somber pissed off i hate my job look. Yes she offered us some flat warm cava as a welcome drink but told us our room wasn't ready. The hotel was definitely not full judging by the few people coming in and out; not really trying to accommodate. So we went for a walk around Madrid, came across a chinese spot in a parking garage on placa de espanya. Definitely go here, and I know you think chinese in spain is sacrilege, was better than a lot of chinese i had in NYC. Got back to hotel, our bags were in our room, but the room had hair all over. Spots of hair on the bad, in the bathtub, on the floor, in the sink. The carpet had black stains all over, and the bed sheets had stains that probably don't come off anymore. Not a pretty sight for a supposed 5 start hotel. Called reception, they called up a maid who didn't speak english and we tried to explain that we wanted to change the bed sheets. She went about it quickly but with a bit of scornful "bloody demanding tourists" look. Then we decided to check out the spa/hammam. There was a pool with interchanging underwater colourful lighting! but.. had some sort of dreadful chemical in it that stung our eyes almost immediately. Still atmosphere was decent. The hammam (steamroom) is big enough only for two people. Definitely not enough heat and dirty! The 2nd day we went there, it wasn't working at all and the person who is supposedly in charge of the spa kept telling us it is. Well when there is no steam and low temperature it can't be working properly. Still she thought about it and said maybe in one or two days they can have somebody come and look at it and then left. So that was lovely.. Had one very nice receptionist help me try to book a table at a nearby new restaurant unfortunately to no success and she was helpful with some relatively local spots. The hotel in general has an aging look, which is strange since it's only been open for 3 years. She showers in the rooms have these large tiles but in the gaps you can see they haven't been cleaned for probably 3 years. Red/orange stains everywhere.. Not a pretty sight. To claim this hotel 5 stars.. not sure who did the evaluation or maybe in the beginning when it opened it was nice. But going downhill fast. The room was a good size facing the back of the building but the walls were thin, could hear, but not over the top bad at all. It would be a nice 4 star place to stay in a chill neighborhood which is next to the metro and walking distance from gran via and all the places. But they should fix some of the small things that you immediately notice and probably stop you from come back like myself and my girl.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Givemeaholiday
Reviews.Content: Not the ultimate in Luxury, but very very comfotable beds, nice baths and ok shower, but mind the floor, the tiles move !!! there is no swimming pool ! it is a large bath, you cannot swim in it, but it is lovely to relax in it, and they let you in 24 hours a day. all in all a pleasant hotel, with free internet, my big bug ! so not a Luxury 5 Star, but nice all the same. Taxi from airport takes about 25 minutes and costs €30. Warning the bathrooms are open plan, so you will only want to share the room with Partner etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: zeppo33
Reviews.Content: The Hospes is very centrally located near all the museums. It is a little pricey, but the room was spotless and the breakfast was good. I found the staff to be helpful/friendly, huge shower, and the bed was very comfortable. I stayed two nights and was pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: DrKaratay
Reviews.Content: Eine sehr gute Atmosphäre! Super freundliches Personal, immer hilfsbereit! Schöne, saubere Zimmer. Reichhaltiges Frühstück! Vielen Dank.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gtsint
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in Hospes Hotel at Madrid with my wife. We stayed in the Dreamilne room. The Hotel is located at the main entrance of the El Retiro park at Plaza de laIndependencia. I believe that this is the best location to stay in Madrid unless you prefer to stay around Plaza de Sol which is actually the ground zero of Madrid. The area around Hospes is of high class, tranquility and at the same time with easy access to everything a tourist or business traveller might need. Salamanca area, El Retiro, Museums are in walking distance whereas the city center, is only 10 minute away by car. You can find a taxi instantly any time outside of the hotel and also Buses, Tour Buses station are just outside of the Hotel. Metro station is just a few meters away and the airport is maximum 20 minutes away. Moreove beside the entrance of the Hotel sis an 24 hour operating cafe/restaurant/bar (Ramses) which seems to be a hot point of the area. The Hotel itself is hosted in a classical old-Madrid style building fully renovated and well maintained. The decoration is bery modern and relaxing. All the personell we met spoke perfectly English and they were capable of providing high class services. What we love however about the Hotel was our room. It is one of the best rooms we have ever visited, perhaps the best in a city hotel. The room was quite big and it looked bigger as it is an open space room that combines, a very large twin bed, a sofa, and an open space marvelous marble bathroom. The WC was at a separate room also spacious. The furniture were modern but with a classic feel and the colours were very calm and relaxing. We did not taste the breakfast as we did not wake up early enough but it looked also of high standards, Overall we definetely recommend this hotel for everybody and for the price we got it, it was also great value for our money too (apart from the breakfast which is a bit expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlistairHurst
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very nice rooms but an Englishman needs a kettle! Beautiful decor, breakfast divine. Really great service, pretty baby friendly too. All in all, top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Everything ok”
Reviews.Author: Tropfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel and were completely satisfied. Having run into serious trouble with our laptop and having a critical business situation at hand, the staff did the very utmost to assist us.Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: littlemissT13
Reviews.Content: We were in Madrid for a night and stayed at the Hospes Madrid. It's a lovely boutique hotel located close to Serrano shopping and just across the Retiro park. Very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly welcoming in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Fadi T
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the Hospes Madrid was a great choice to make. It was close enough to all the main attractions while maintaining its splendor just opposite the charming Retiro park. My stay there was accentuated by the 5-star service and attention to detail throughout. My room was very comfortable and the breakfast was beautifully set out every morning. This hotel is a Madrid attraction in itself. It doesn't matter whether you're a thrill-seeking city explorer or just want to unwind in the relaxing atmosphere, this hotel is highly recommended. I found Hospes staff to be very professional and super helpful so don't be surprised if they go beyond the call of duty to make sure your stay there is just right.

Reviews.Title: “magical stay in madrid”
Reviews.Author: sharon m
Reviews.Content: From the moment arrived at Hospes Madrid, we were greeted warmly. The service and staff could not be better! The location is perfect - a great view of the Puerta de Alcala, excellent shopping along Serrano street, steps away from Retiro park, close to the Prado, etc.... The hotel was quiet, hip and modern. The rooms were beautifully appointed, with the most comfortable beds ever. The rooms were surprisingly quiet, particularly because there are great outdoor cafes right outside of the hotel (which are great for an afternoon coffee, etc.). We would absolutely stay at Hospes again, and wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone travelling to Madrid. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Astonishingly quiet room in a busy square”
Reviews.Author: galleon1
Reviews.Content: In spite of the convenient location in a busy square within walking distance of the major museums most of the rooms, i.e. those at the back, are absolutely quiet. We didn't hear a thing although we had the window wide open. The room was very well equipped and the service as to be expected in a 5-star hotel, including towels which were changed twice a day. The staff were extremely friendly. The best city hotel at that price I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Megustaviajar007
Reviews.Content: The Hospes' location is great. Close to good shopping in Salamanca district, to trendy Chueca and to the museums. Different kinds of restaurants are very near. Try Recoletos Street, and you will find all sorts of choices, from trendy La Cesta to Moroccan Al Munia. The front view to Puerta de Alcala is Madrid at its best, makes you want to start out walking and enjoy it. The staff at the Hospes is very helpful, we arrived on an early transatlantic flight, at 8:00 am, earlier than check in time and they let us use the relaxing beds at the spa so we could take a nap to help us with our jet lag until our room was ready. The rooms are weill appointed, though as in other hotels I find there are too many digital lights (phone, tv, night lights) for my liking as I prefer to sleep in a very dark room. They have a two level room which we were originally assigned but we found its low ceiling somewhat oppresive and upon our request they immediately changed it to a one level room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mpremoli
Reviews.Content: Modern, Small and hipe hotel in puerta de Alcala. Great Service, close to atocha. Aree is really nice as you are close to the main points, but without the traffic and noise.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: A truly wonderful hotel with warm and welcoming staff who could not do enough for you. We stayed here in early September in a beautiful suite on the top floor. As this was part of our tour of Spanish cities, we had been very careful in our choice of hotels, yet this hotel was still the best we stayed in by some distance. If you are looking for a small 5* + hotel this is the place to go in Madrid. We shall return! If only for the excellent chilled glass of champagne on arrival

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jrillinois
Reviews.Content: Very hip, wonderful mod furnishings. Incredibly kind and helpful staff that figured out how to accommodate our family of four by giving us the room with the fold-out sofa (surprisingly comfy). Very close to the Retiro Park and two great playgrounds within it. Was a great balance of hipster for mom and dad and close to playground for kids. The only negative is that the pool was very, very small and located in a very tight space in the basement so you couldn't even really hang out by it. It was also pretty warm, so not good for children or much use at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in an excellent position”
Reviews.Author: AJCG
Reviews.Content: Modern, efficient, beautiful old building on the outside. Excellent position opposite the Retiro park an a smart, clean area of Madrid. Had a deluxe room, the design of which was a little "quirky" - very large room but no drawer units for clothes; open plan wardrobe; no desk or obvious place to use/charge laptops etc. However, very comfortable. Breakfast somewhat pricey/ lovely outside terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sarah4675
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location - very convenient for both metro and walking to nearby locations. Excellent breakfast (well worth upgrading your room to include this if it isn't already included) and complimentary drinks on arrival were a nice touch. Very courteous and knowledgable staff. Room was very luxurious and bed exceptionnaly comfy. Only downside was that food in hotel was very expensive (although excellent quality). However there were plenty of nearby places to eat if you didn't want to pay hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel”
Reviews.Author: trickydickdicky
Reviews.Content: Loved it and will go back. The room was smallish but had a big open plan bathroom so the overall size was fine. Staff are great and very attentive. The breakfast was nice too but the restaurant is half underground which is a little odd and you can't have it outside on the roadside which would be really nice.

Reviews.Title: “We Absolutely Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rooster64
Reviews.Content: What a jewel. From the friendly and knowledgeable staff to the fun and convenient location (everything walking distance - or 2 stops on the subway) to the cloud of a bed and the combination classic with modern design of the room - WE LOVED THIS PLACE. We cannot recommend it higher. A pleasant 15 minute walk to the center of everything - and Retiro Park across the street - and Prado a 7 minute direct walk. Also - right next door to a fun restaurant and club (sound proof windows keep the noise out when it is time for sleep). The hotel also has great food and a really fun bar as well. All in all - this was a fun a city-hotel as you can find. While it might not be a "resort" - it is perfect for Madrid. Comfortable bed, well appointed room and bathroom, free and fast WiFi, everything was just how it should be. We will return to this hotel whenever we are in Madrid - which hopefully will be often.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid at its best”
Reviews.Author: Mogens28
Reviews.Content: The Hospes is a hotel in the DESIGN HOTEL group. It's small, minimalistic with a high standard, both of rooms and restaurant (you more or less design your own breakfast). The service is optimal, you're not just a number. AND then the location is just about perfect. Walking distance to all >must see< places in Madrid, not to forget the Parque del Retiro just opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly design hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: georgebilthoven
Reviews.Content: Hospes Madrid is located central for all the tourist landmarks. Nice room with in the morning good breakfast and a nice terass outside. Welcome letter from the manager; in which hotel do you find that. Service is allround and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: RM_London2
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip and staed in this hotel, it really was a great find. The staff are very attentive and helpful. I agree that the breakfast is very good, the room was fantastic and spacious, and the cleanliness was impeccible. It is not the greatest value as I feel it is expensive, but it is a great htoel and you get what you pay for. The location right next to Retiro and on Plaza de la Independencia was fabulous, perfect for jumping in to taxis for meetings in the Norht, but would be a short walk to central locations. The hotel took delivery of my paperwork prior to my arrival and placed it in my room for me. I great experience, and I would definitely stay again. I would certainly also reccomend this for holdiay-makers, there are some great places on the Plaza to have a drink, and I'm sure it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: danpb
Reviews.Content: I can positively say this is the best hotel in spain's capital city. What a rooms! If you're lucky too, you'll get astonishing views of Puerta de Alcala. Exquisite and informal service, delicious treats at Senzone restaurant (wake up early for breakfast, its worth it). Perfect stay

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: gcosta58
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days, after Christmas in Madrid and stayed at the Hospes. The location was perfect, right on the Puerta Alcala. We wanted to hit the museums and it was all within walking distance. Rooms were clean, neat and slick. Breakfast? AMAZING. Too bad we decided to eat out every morning, except for the last day. Stone's throw from Serrano, Paseo Castellana and a nice walk to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel-Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Pooks2Go
Reviews.Content: Before I start, I have to confess that I had studied, lived, and worked in Madrid in the late nineties so I had a familiarity with the city and layout that most tourists do not have. I also picked this hotel based on location (since I didn't really need to be in the middle) and ambiance of the hotel. Granted, I was a student the first time I was there so your experience and expectations are quite when you're 20 then when you're 33. My boyfriend and I stayed at Hospes Madrid in early November and had a wonderful time. Firstly, the location is amazing. It's right by the Retiro Park on the Puerta de Alcala in the Salamanca section of Madrid. It's a fairly chic residential area and near the high-end shopping area so if you are looking for something smack in the middle of the tourist stuff, this may not be for you. However, if you're looking for a chic little hotel in a nice neighborhood that is still in walking distance from the sites (Prado, Puerta del Sol, etc) this is a good alternative. The people at the desk were extremely helpful and nice. There is one guy, I can't remember his name, who did most of our reservations and planning and he was excellent. He recommended a great restaurant that was close by on the last night. We also got upgraded to a room facing the front with a balcony which was cool because the MTV awards were happening at the Puerta de Alcala that weekend. We live in NYC so noise isn't a major thing for us but if you're not used to street noise, I can see where a room facing the street could be annoying. The rooms themselves are quite spacious and well appointed. Agree with someone who said the rooms could definitely use desks! I had to do work on the trip so it was weird having to do it on the bed. The first room we had was an interior so we didn't have a lot of sunlight - we couldn't tell if it was sunny or not outside. However, it had a huge bath (I like baths) and the bathroom was nice. Yes, the closets have no doors but that didn't really bother us. The new room had plenty of light since we faced the street and the weather happened to be amazing the days we were there (sunny and 70s). No bath tub in the new room but that was ok. Again, I loved the location since it was in the residential area (similar to staying on the Upper East Side versus staying in Times Square or Midtown) and near the shops and the park. It was also easy to walk to the museums and everything (we live in NY so all we do is walk). The hotel was small and there wasn't much of a scene happening which is what we like. If you are looking for action, there is a hip bar/club/resto called Ramses next door. They were hosting an MTV party the week we were there. We also didn't eat at the hotel but apparently the restaurant there is very good. We were only there a few days and had already picked restaurants we wanted to eat at. We ate at Iroco, La Terraza del Casino (amazing!!), El Tomate, VIPs, and one more I can't remember). Food is amazing in Madrid! Another plus is that the wireless is free! A rarity nowadays but greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, it is a 3/4 stars hotel with manager focused only on money!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucaNavigator
Reviews.Content: Failures in many different ways and disappointing on multiple aspects. I want to share my experience so that you have an idea of what to expect. I stayed 3 nights, used all services including the SPA so I have a good idea of what this hotel can offer. 1. Check-in: quick and courteous, "we'll send your bag right up sir". I had half an hour to have a shower and go to my business dinner. After 20 minutes I came back down to get my own bag still in the lobby!! 2. The room: room is small, as in many European hotels, but critically there is no desk. Not a place where to use your laptop but in the bed. I immediately complained and asked to speak to the manager. The manager was "busy". Ok I'll talk to her tomorrow I thought. In the meantime I found the cover of an electric plug on the floor. I pick it up and leave it on the bedside table. Weird that the cleaning staff did not notice a plastic piece clearly coming from the plug on the floor. 3. Design: when you open the door a half closed safe welcomes you and some empty hangers. Yes the door opens onto the closet which has no doors. After 3 days of stay you need to use the closet so what welcomes you is your dirty shirts hanging, used ties or a bag with your dirty laundry and your empty luggage. I come from Milan home of the design and the first thing welcoming you is a closet with no doors is a big mistake. Even worse the bathroom is in plain sight from the bed (of course the two sinks not the toilette). Under the sink is a waste basket (the only one in the room). If you throw away the newspaper in the morning it will still be there saying good morning to you the following day (the turn down service at night does not empty it). Final negative note on the design: the lou is in a separate area with a door (finally :-) and there is the bidet to wash yourself. There are also towels to dry up but NO SOAP. Maybe the designers thought you just need water??? I put the soap there and the cleaning service took it away and put it back in plain view at the sink. 4. Cleaning staff. Remember the piece of electric plug I had picked up and put on the bedside table when I checked in? Well 3 days later it was still there on the bedside table!!! Maybe they think guests should repair the electric plugs themselves, I am no engineer so I did not do it, maybe I was wrong. On top of that I had moved the waste basket so that it was not in plain view when I woke up in the morning by putting it near the shower. All 3 days it was put back where it was in plan sight!! Maybe they think it adds to the visual experience to see not only your shaving cream, used razor, open soap, toothpaste when you wake up (remember no doors on the bathroom) they want to make sure you also see the waste basket in case you love it !!! 5. Manager: I have asked again on the 3 day to see manager and guess what?? Yes she was "busy" again. I tried one last time the morning I left and she was, again, "busy". When a manager has no time to see an unhappy customer for 3 days it already tells you a lot about the kind of hotel. 6. SPA. It was ok but with only one person as staff so you had to adapt to her schedule because they could not bring someone in from the outside. 7. Lobby: very small, derived from a corridor, not a place where to have a meeting but the coffee shop on the first floor is welcoming. Overall if you like some poor design, managers ignoring you, no place to sit down and work, a bidet where you are not supposed to wash yourself with soap and to look at your bathroom or closet from your bed than you have to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust the front desk”
Reviews.Author: christiebeach
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say I never stayed at this hotel, although I paid to stay here. After the Iceland volcano rendered me unable to leave the UK, I called the hotel to cancel our vacation and they told me I would still have to pay one night (despite being stuck in another country with no way to get to Madrid). The nice woman at the front desk said we could use this credit toward a future stay. I did not think to get this offer in writing since we were busy figuring out how to get from UK back home to NY. Cut to October and I tried to make a reservation for a trip to Madrid and use this credit. Since I never received it in writing the hotel will not honor it despite seeing that I paid for one night and seeing that I was never able to make it. For this level of hotel I am disappointed that their customer service is not better. Shame on Hospes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: burnig
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, style suited me perfectly. Furnishings, room design, everything...loved the modern contemporary feel. Location, turn right out the entrance and walk 10 mins to find the start of old Madrid, or turn left out of the door for modern Madrid. Huge park opposite, and close to a Metro station. Staff were warm and welcoming, always taking the time to say hello. No room noise (even from lift next door) very peaceful, all room had free wi-fi. Highly recommend and when I return to Madrid, hotel Hospes will be the place I'll be looking to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern city hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexSpeak
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a main area of Madrid, right across from a park. Modern well lit rooms with over head rain effect showers. Typical breakfast of cheeses, meats, and bakery in small relaxing rooms. Most rooms have a courtyard view, great for natural light. Best for business or pleasure but not for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dontlosemyluggage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Madrid for the first time (6 days), prior to the trip we did many hotel research and decided to go with Hospes Madrid. The hotel location worked out well for us since we're tourist we're planning to hop on the Madrid Tour bus which stops right in front and across the street. The taxi ride from airport was less than 20 minutes about $25 euros and the taxi ride to the train station is less than 10 minutes about $10 euros. In addition the Retiro Park and Plaza de Independencia was right in front on the hotel. We also took some sight seeing tours from Julia Travel which is located next to Plaza de Espana and it's about $5 euros taxi ride from the hotel. The hotel entrance is a bit hard to notice, in fact our taxi driver almost missed it so be in the look out for the sign (also look for Cafe and Te, it's right next to the hotel). There are may ATMs near by the hotel which was convenient. We only used 2 services from the hotel; breakfast and laundry, both services (variety of food and laundry delivery time) were mediocre for the price. However the servers at breakfast are great. There is a Cafe and Te right next to the hotel, decent alternative to hotel food/price. Our room (307) is right next to the elevator, obviously we're a bit hesitant about hearing all the noises but we never did. Overall very comfortable room didn't have any problems with the exception of the pillow (it's quite soft per our preference). The bathroom is an open design with a separate toilet and shower (love the shower!) stall with glass door. It may or may not be ideal for business travelers as it does not have a proper desk to work on and the complimentary Wi-Fi signal was quite weak in our room. Iron and ironing board are available upon request. During our research for hotels in Madrid we read many comments (in general) about hotel receptionist being rude or not helpful. It depends on the individual, we flew British Airways to Madrid and BA lost my wife's luggage, we asked one of the receptionist to help us contact BA/Iberia to track down the luggage for us in Spanish. The individual we talked to was quite helpful and tried her best to assist us however a few others doesn't speak English that well and noticed it would be difficult for them to help. Overall it was an enjoyable stay, we paid about $150-$160 per night (discounted rate that is none refundable).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but major issues with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: DQC76
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Great location ... very nice neighborhood and great access to everywhere you want to go - if you like boutique hotels, this hotel is along those lines ... small number of rooms, modern design, etc Negatives: - layout of the rooms is a DISASTER ... there are NO DOORS on the bathroom! i had a suite, and bed was directly facing the wide open bathroom (meaning stepping out of the shower directly facing the bed as there is no door) ... and of course, the shower door was glass, meaning that you can lay in bed & see reflection of the person in the shower - after changing rooms, the 2nd room was marginally better b/c the large headboard faced the wide open bathroom ... but only a marginal improvement - carpet on the wood floor was absolutely filthy (think a college dorm room) ... stained and worn - hotel on the verge of needing a refurb/upgrade as many of the pieces in the room are a bit worn - bar was like a morgue ... absolutely not a place to spend any amount of time i would like to be more charitable, but even the staff wasn't that helpful (though they tried & were friendly) ... given this place advertises itself as a 5-star, i expected a lot more so i cannot recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very nice rooms. Average service”
Reviews.Author: sayaz
Reviews.Content: Dreamer's rooms (room 209) is very spacious and agreeable. Very good bed. Location of the hotel is good, in front of the Retiro Park. The food is quite terrible (room service) and the service in general is pretty average. For this reason, I would not stay there again. Spa closed on Sundays and Mondays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: buford33
Reviews.Content: Hospes Madrid is in a terrific location and the hotel is good however, it is really a 4 star not a 5 star property. While our room was spacious with a separate shower and tub, king size bed, nice pillows, robes and slippers, nice bathroom amenities and three windows that opened, the carpets and couch were badly stained giving the room a dirty feel. In the very small lobby the carpets are threadbare, the couches badly worn and the whole place, while only three years old, is in need of a facelift. The staff was very nice and assisted us in many ways for which we were very grateful. They managed to get us tickets for a bullfight which was sold out, and helped us with restaurants, sights, and other necessities. There were a few glitches here and there, but overall they were knowledgeable and helpful. The breakfast was good, but nothing special. The flat screen television was new, but was supposed to have CNN International and CNBC, but we were not able to get either giving us only one English-speaking channel. Turn down consisted of turning down a corner of the sheets – no water, no treat, nothing else. There is free WiFi in the room, which was a real plus. Do not plan on doing any laundry here. The cost to do one pair of underwear is almost $15, one shirt in excess of $20 US and slacks approaching $25 --- just plain ridiculous. While we considered the Hospes Palau in Valencia to be a real find, we would recommend this strictly for the location and rate.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in a perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: marshallesq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a five night stay at the Hospes Madrid. The service: Prior to my arrival the staff were fully invested in helping me reserve restaurant reservations. My thanks go out to the two Silvias. Check in was warm and prompt. I requested a certain location for my deluxe alcala room and was pleased to get the exact location. From the front desk staff, to the wait staff at the buffet breakfast all were polite and very eager to help. The Room: The room was an oasis of comfort. The bedding on the king bed was firm but not too hard,just right. Sheets and comforter were cozy. The room was a good size and included two comfortable chairs, plenty of walk about room, a good flat screen tv but no English channels(so what,who's there to watch tv). The bathroom was huge with his/her sinks, a stand alone shower and a huge tub great for a soak. Good soaps etc(per my wife's evaluation). Separate enclosed w.c. The View: The hotel is located on the Plaza de la Independencia and faces the monumental Puerta de Alcala beautiful both day and night. Best of all the hotel is directly across the plaza from Madrid's equivalent of New York's Central Park. The only difference is that The Retiro Park makes Central Park look like a sad sister. The hotel is only minutes from the major art museums and every major international designer store one can think of. As an aside the Madrid Metro is clean, safe and inexpensive. There is a metro stop only steps from the hotel. By the way the room is fantastically soundproofed. The hotel has a great buffet breakfast,I get hungry thinking about it. There is a small gym with a few up to date cardio machines and weights. There is also a spa. Can you tell I loved the place(and I have no stock in the chain). Hasta luego Hospes amigos.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: We had a large room which had an open bathroom solution with a large tub, a wonderful shower room and separate WC. Large double bed was very good. Flat screen TV had only Spanish channels as far as I could see. All kept in white and silver, spots on the sofa and carpet. We found the lighting to be inadequate for the corridor and the closet. Nice bar and breakfast restaurant serving a very good buffet. I can gladly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stylish place”
Reviews.Author: gaspargonzalez
Reviews.Content: Located on the lively Plaza de la Independencia, from the outside you can hardly notice this to be a hotel. Lobby is equally small. But from the first moment you enter, you notice the very personal touch this hotel offers you. Rooms are absolutely amazing, in size, lay-out (wide open bathroom) and fine decoration. My room had a view on the inner court, what was a bit strange initially. But the calmness was highly preferred above the noisy streetside. As many reviewers pointed out, the location is very central. Only pity is the ongoing roadworks around the plaza and the calle Seranos.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: chrissi99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hospes is ideally situated: close to a beautiful park, in walking distance to all the major museums and really close - indeed - to all the good shopping areas. We enjoyed our stay very much and the hotel staff did everything to make us feel at home. We would definetly come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martinius34
Reviews.Content: Great location... all of the rooms are great... specially the ones overlooking the puerta de Alcala.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel with lovely rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: Ae68
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, very modern style. Cocktails quite pricey €12 each and breakfast very continental - no options for cooked alternatives. We stayed at new year and they closed the hotel bar for a €200 meal on new years eve (which we didn't have), so we were not allowed in and could not get a cocktail before going out. Needless to say we were a bit disappointed but after complaining to the manager he was very nice and found us a quiet corner lounge sofa and brought us cocktails! Which was all we wanted. Free Wifi in rooms excellent. Great location, opposite the park so nice and quiet but 10 mins walk from main streets. Overall great hotel and would recommend it and come back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigerdw
Reviews.Content: great location,excellent staff who make you feel special and nothing is too much trouble for them.breakfast was excellent,good quality with great service.located right beside the upmarket salamanca area and close to all the art galleries.the only downside was the room we had could have been larger with a poor view and no bath,but overall i would recommend

Reviews.Title: “beautiful in the middle of total chaos”
Reviews.Author: JoCoiner
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel. Modern and comfortable. Semi-open bathroom, though, is not everybody's cup of tea, even if the latest trend. Acrylic table can also be a real trap to walk into. The worst!!!! At the moment, and I guess this will continue for some time, the normally beautiful Salamanca quarter is totally dug up. They are building a new railway tunnel and the Plaza de la Independencia where the hotel entrance is situated becomes an underground car park. So, taxis cannot reach the entrance of the hotel. You have to climb over dirt paths to get into the hotel with your shoes plus luggage dirty. What a reception in a five star hotel! When you leave you have to do the same. This should reflect on extra bonus, but it doesn't. The air-condition plus heating was so noisy that we had to change room the first night.The extremely loud, jazzy music in the bar was also annoying. Otherwise very recommendable with extremely caring and polite staff. Will probably come back in a year's time when the building will be finished.I wouldn't recommend the hotel at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel. Near Perfect Rooms and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BruceEvans
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel through tripadvisor, at a great price. The location, although busy, is perfect: on Plaza de la Indepencia, across the street from the Retiro (Central Park), right near a metro stop, and a 15-20 minute walk from the museums, the old city, and shopping. Around the corner is a residential neighborhood with nice restaurants. The room was perfect: large, immaculate, and soundproofed, with a great king-sized bed. It has a semi-separate bathroom with a free standing oval tub, a huge rain shower, double sinks, and finishes you'd love to have at home. It also has the latest trendy high-end hotel smoked glass door on the toilet. I can't wait for that to be over. The only odd part, which takes nothing away from the magnificant room, was a large closet with hangars, a high shelf, and no drawers. Where do you put your socks and underwear? Service was amazing. An enthusiastic staff, who learns your name on the first day, will make any arrangement for you. They made a reservation in a Michelin starred restaurant on the same day, and told us how to get there. They steered us away from a slightly too touristy meal, and told us where to go. We tipped them, but they never seem to expect it. The hotel and the staff is very non-snobby. They always make you feel at home. The staff is very gay-friendly. Breakfast was excellent: meats, cheeses, cereal, smoked salmon, juices, the best espresso-based coffee, and omelets made to order. The hotel has a teeny gym and a spa, but we did not us those facilities. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We would stay there again, or move in, in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Your Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamtravelwonder
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for its price. However, the service was average and the room was not that great. When we arrived we had to get the sheets in our room changed because there were stains. The staff was very apologetic, and they changed the sheets ASAP. The food was pretty good and there are great authentic restaurants in the area. The staff was good at pointing out places to visit like museums, art galleries, etc. Overall, I would recommend it if you are concerned about budget. But in general, the staff needs to work on its service.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: UziTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 days in September. Great location - right across from the Retiro Park, within 10 min walk of the big three museums, 5 min by metro (15-20 min on foot) from Sol. While extensive works were going on outside day and night, I heard nothing, and I am a light sleeper. The hotel probably does not match most 5 star hotels for public areas, but it costs half of the Ritz and similar places (I got a deal through one of the hotel agencies and paid 160 euro/night, incl breakfast). Service was excellent, when I asked for a place where I could connect the internet they lent me a laptop without charge! Good breakfast, you can order many items without extra charge. Large room, king-size bed, also table and small couch and armchair, modern marble shower with large showerhead. Storage space could be larger, but was OK for me. Spotlessly clean, towels changed twice a day. An excellent hotel at a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hospes was a real wow”
Reviews.Author: TimRudd
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the staff were genuinely helpful and friendly and really got everything right. The hotel is tastefully furnished in modern style and is both comfortable as well as stunningly beautiful. Great decor in bedroom, great shower, nice cosmetics, and really good well prepared fresh food. Hospes is different from other hotels - modern, young, fun, friendly, and excellent service. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Heidbummer
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. I had a room at the rear of the property on the top floor. Very quiet. Excellent shower and Korres toiletries a nice treat. (Those expecting a bath would I suspect need to specify that). Clean (checked twice a day including topping up said toiletries). Attentive staff, excellent buffet breakfast. Basic but well kept gym. The "pool" is in effect a very big jacuzzi, but after pounding the streets and galleries all day a good soak is a treat. Ignoring the guide books exhortations to go tapas crawling, I did eat in one night. Pricey but excellent modern Spanish food. (Try the hake cheeks with gnocchi. Mmmmmm). It´s handy for the galleries. 2 changes on the metro on the way from the airport would be a pfaff with luggage, but travelling light I was in my hotel within an hour of touching down, allowing a bit of early evening preview of the Prado (which is free entry after 6pm until close at 8). Largely used it would seem by Spanish guests, and perhaps to some extent a business hotel, nonetheless with very little Spanish I was made to feel welcome and looked after. If and when I come back to Madrid I don´t see any point in staying anywhere else to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gnicDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent three most enjoyable days at this splendid 5* hotel. We usually struggle to find a quiet room in hotels, particularly in cities, but not here. Our room at the rear of the hotel was really comfortable and allowed us to sleep in late without any noise! We didn`t try the restaurant, preferring to eat out but our breakfasts of coffee and pastries were excellent and well priced. The staff are a delight and could not have been more helpful - they really added to the pleasure of our stay. The Hospes is extremely well located being immediately opposite the Alcala Gate and delightful Park de Retiro as well as being at the end of the best shopping street in Madrid! The Prado, other main galleries and Botanical Gardens are all within a few minutes walk, while the old town and Royal Palace can be easily reached three stops down the line from the nearby Metro station. If you go to Madrid, try this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, cool boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: This is such a lovely, cool, hip, yet unpretentious hotel in a great location. I spent a lot of time researching where to stay in Madrid and am so happy I chose Hospes Madrid. The staff is so friendly and helpful, even hooking my iPhone up with wireless internet. The location is perfect - right across from the Retiro and within 10 -- 15 minutes of all of Madrid's great museums, right on the edge of Salamanca. It's close enough to the bars, clubs, but not too close, which was just what I wanted. My room was lovely, huge (especially by European standards) and immaculate, and I got a great price on the hotel website. The spa/steam/hamman were an plus. I would go back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Sarah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel. We had booked to see IL Divo and decided to make it a small break. The Hospes Madrid is a very nice hotel. The rooms are quite large and very clean. The staff are very friendly and keen to help. Breakfast was excellent catering to most tastes, full english and continental. The hotel is well situated with easy access to parks, Madrid Palace and the Cathedral. A couple of tips:- Very nice restuarants can be found close to the hotel, I particular liked Resturante Borbollon. Be careful of ladies with flowers. Very good at distractions and removing money from wallet!! Anyway, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, elegant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tootbelle
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff...great location right on Retiro Park. Lovely building away from the City Center noise but within walking distance of the Prado. The included breafast was varied and delicous. Some lack of closet space if you are there more than a couple of days but the bathroom makes up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hospes!”
Reviews.Author: sassIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that I would definitely return to. On arrival in Madrid, we got a taxi from outside the airport to the hotel. The total cost of which was 39 euro. This was far too expensive and if you're good with directions, I would strongly recommend getting the metro which stops about 100 yrds from the hotel. We did this on the way back to the airport and it cost us a grand total of 4 euro :) The hotel itself is beautiful. It's quite modern in decoration and our room was very large. It was open plan so essentially it was three rooms made into one. The bathroom consisted of a shower, toilet, two sinks and a large bath. The bath was in the centre of the bathroom and the shower behind a glass door. The hotel provided breakfast in the restaurant every morning as part of our bill. There was a great range of food from pastries and fruit to bacon and omlettes. However, one tip is to avoid room service. We paid 15 euro for one bowl of soup!! There are numerous restaurants close by and we used our guide book to help us identify what we were looking for. The hotel staff are excellent and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The room was cleaned to an excellent standard each day and I cannot fault the service at all. The bed was very comfortable but make sure you ask for some different pillows as the ones we had were so soft that they offered little support. A very small niggle in the garnd scheme of things really! The location of the hotel was great and we were about 5 mins away from Sol by metro which suited us perfectly. The area was lovely and the there is a fab park just across the road which is great for a stroll on a sunny day and was buzzing with people when we were there. One point on the airport - don't get there hours and hours in advance on your return journey as there are no chairs for people to sit on and you will have to resort to sitting on the floor!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winelover37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 days at the Hospes Madrid in May 2008. This newly renovated hotel has a great location at the Plaza de Independencia in front of the Royal Garden, near the shopping area, near the museums, and about 15 minutes walk to the old city. We had reserved the only junior suite that was so baldly designed that we asked to be moved in a deluxe room. So we visited most type of rooms and we found out that the rooms on the atrium were quiet but lacked natural light. And the the duplex rooms on the fourth and fifth floors were crampy. Finally, our deluxe room was in front on the Plaza de Independencia and had lot of natural light. Il was a very nice room with a superb open bathroom. The bed and the pillows were very confortable. But, the room was too small for the price: there are no desk where you can write or put a computer and no drawers to put your underwears. The television can only be looked from the bed ( beacuse of the lack of space) and has only one English channel (CNN) on more than 35 channels. We think that the hotel designer was given carte blanche and a good budget; so the emphasis was put on design and he forgot many practicalities. Housekeeping was very good. Front desk was allways ready to help, but they do not have a concierge who can make good recommendations and get the last table available, like it is the practice in a five star hotel. We recommend this hotel only of you take a deluxe room on the Plaza de Independencia and that you get a good price. This is certainly not a five star hotel like they advertised it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stena
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located in a central area of Madrid. Right on the main Plaza de la Independencia, which is Spain's equivalent of the Arc de Triomphe. In saying that, the room we had was extremely quiet and we heard no street noise. The sound proofing in the hotel also appeared to be very good. Retiro metro station is a few minutes walk, as are the smart boutiques and eateries of Salamanca. The area is generally a business district and is quiet in the evenings, so if you are looking for nightlife and atmosphere on your doorstep this might not be the place. However a 15-20 minute stroll and you are in Old Madrid with its narrow streets, small bars and cafes. The hotel is very nicely decorated and is extremely comfortable. The rooms are open plan and the bathrooms are wonderfully kitted out with marble tiles, his and hers sinks, huge oval bath and a separate 'rain' type shower. One slight criticism is that there are no English speaking TV channels available in the rooms, although the TV brochure does advertise these. The staff are very pleasant and will go out of their way to help. We had two problems, both of which were resolved by the staff in a professional and very accommodating manner. A very good sign that they care about customer satisfaction and service. The hotel does lack a certain buzz, but this is maybe because it is still early days, but the hotel restaurant (Ramses) is a place to be been and was very buzzy all weekend. Overall a good stay and we would return if we were back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but needs to up its game”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: Certainly if you are looking for a stylish, boutique hotel in Madrid - you would not go far wrong with the Hospes. It is in a great location, overlooking the city's main park and close to the key art galleries. The intimate environment has also been beautifully designed. Our bedroom was very nicely laid out, with an open plan bathroom (which is only fine, if you are on your own, or with someone you truly love....). The finish of the room could have been a little better (especially as the Hospes is not cheap) and the sink looked beautiful, but was a nightmare to use (shallow and not good for shaving). There was also a very nice intimate bar and restaurant, along with a lovely courtyard (which I am sure is great in the Summer). The staff are very friendly and helpful. However, the main fault of the hotel is it lacks the five star polish it markets itself to have. Tea trays that were delivered to the room had great crockery and glasswear, but were thrown together. Breakfast lacked polish - as did the bar (which also had a slight whiff of drains). There was also a lovely plasma screen in the room, which only had Spanish channels. If the hotel wishes to attract an international, well travelled clientele (especially business travellers), it is going to have to up its game. Not wanting to sound too negative - it is certainly a wonderful choice for a weekend/leisure break in Madrid. A bit of standards and training and it will be a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: PortoTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hopses Madrid is located in Plaza Independenzia, also known as Puerta de Alcalá, Madrids own "Arc du Triomphe". The outside architecture is typically early 20th century Madrid. The hotel is very close to the museum triangle, at the end of fashionable Serrano Street, Madrid's main shopping artery, and right across the entrance to the wonderful Retiro Park. You can easily stroll around on foot for a whole weekend, but taxi drives are inexpensive. The hotel experience is very pleasant. The staff is very friendly and attentive, the public rooms, although still lacking any patine, are charming and carefully thought, but empty and lacking in atmosphere. This will probably improve with time, as the hotel is still new, and relatively unknown, at least for cab drivers. The decor is a bit too glamour-urban-chic for my personal liking. Period furnishings painted white, black, silver or gold, combined with medium glitter fabrics seems to be the standard decor for fashion boutique hotels. Neighboring social mecca restaurant Ramses, by Philip Stark himself is of course a prime example of the genre. The room was lovely and luxurious, with stucco moldings in the ceiling, big comfortable bed with very smooth linens, large LCD TV, and a wonderful bathroom, with a big white marble shower cabin. The breakfast was excellent, with a big variety of spanish smoked hams, cheeses and delicious pastries. The bread was superb. You could order a variety of hot dishes, omelets and vegetables. At 30 Euros it's a bit expensive, so beware as it is not included. The spa was small but effective. A 40 room hotel would hardly have use for a big spa, and the small pool was the ideal for relaxing after a long saturday afternoon museum and shopping spree. Massages were unavailable, as the therapists were booked for the afternoon. At 190 Euros a night for a standard room, the hotel delivers a fair deal, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the Hospes”
Reviews.Author: MJJRJ
Reviews.Content: The Hospes hotel was a peaceful oasis in Madrid. The room was extremely comfortable (especially the bed and pillows) and the bathroom was wonderful. Despite the hotel being set on a busy square, our room (at the back of the hotel) was very quiet and restful. Our room did lack a sensible sized draw to put underwear in, a very minor quibble. The breakfast was exceptional, but the price was expensive (almost 60 euros for two!) The staff are helpful and attentive. A wonderful place to stay, close to the smart shopping area and art museums.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: fdutch
Reviews.Content: Most definitely the hippest and hottest place to stay in Madrid. Location, location, location is what it is all about, situated opposite the Alcala gate and the Retiro park around the corner from Serrano for high end shopping, very close to the Prado Museum and the Thyssen Bornemisza collection. The hotel has 41 rooms, an incredible restaurant called Senzone and a dedicated Spa building with indoor pool and treatment rooms. Service is fantastic, rooms are very well appointed, design atmosphere with incredible comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “great luxury hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: vigy
Reviews.Content: This is a beatuifully renovated building decorated in modern minimalistic way, centrally located and close to the main shopping area and museum's. The hotel is graded as a five star hotel but as it just opened in Oct'07 it is not fully up and running. So, if you don't mind having the comfort of a 5* hotel but the lack of the facilities you would expect in a 5* hotel then book here before it fully opens and take advantage of the good deals which are available. Be warned, there is no mention on the web or when we checked in that the spa or pool facitlities are not open yet or the bar and restaurant has a limited menu available. We asked for a white wine and were told that sherry was all that was available until we insisted and evenually a - very nice - glass of white wine appeared. Advise you to book a restaurant near by in advance, which hotel staff are happy to do. The rooms are very well decorated and spacious with large walk in marble showers and double sinks. (shower was not very powerful though). Hotel staff very accomodating but felt they were still trying to find their feet and no-one seemed to have the experience or authority you would expect from a five star hotel. Breakfasts were delicious with a wide choice of fresh fruit, breads, meats and cooked breakfast - we were on a room only basis so it was quite pricey but worth it for a good start to the day.
